title: building rustc in a worktree doesn't work anymore because of nested submodules

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
## Meta
```
$ git --version
git version 2.18.0
$ $RUSTC --version
rustc 1.30.0-dev
```

## STR

```
$ cd PATH/TO/RUST/REPO
$ git worktree add ../my-worktree-name
$ cd ../my-worktree-name
$ ./x.py build
```

## Expected Result

Worktree compiles, same as without a worktree

## Actual result

Build gives this error:

```
running: "ccache" "cc" "-O2" "-ffunction-sections" "-fdata-sections" "-fPIC" "-ffunction-sections" "-fdata-sections" "-fPIC" "-m64" "-m64" "-fno-builtin" "-fvisibility=hidden" "-ffreestanding" "-fomit-frame-pointer" "-DVISIBILITY_HIDDEN" "-o" "<MY_WORKTREE>/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-std/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/build/compiler_builtins-bfcf98270f103c08/out/../../libcompiler_builtins/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/absvdi2.o" "-c" "../../libcompiler_builtins/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/absvdi2.c"
cargo:warning=cc: error: ../../libcompiler_builtins/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/absvdi2.c: No such file or directory
cargo:warning=cc: fatal error: no input files
cargo:warning=compilation terminated.
exit code: 1

--- stderr
thread 'main' panicked at '

Internal error occurred: Command "ccache" "cc" "-O2" "-ffunction-sections" "-fdata-sections" "-fPIC" "-ffunction-sections" "-fdata-sections" "-fPIC" "-m64" "-m64" "-fno-builtin" "-fvisibility=hidden" "-ffreestanding" "-fomit-frame-pointer" "-DVISIBILITY_HIDDEN" "-o" "<MY_WORKTREE>/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-std/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/build/compiler_builtins-bfcf98270f103c08/out/../../libcompiler_builtins/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/absvdi2.o" "-c" "../../libcompiler_builtins/compiler-rt/lib/builtins/absvdi2.c" with args "cc" did not execute successfully (status code exit code: 1).

', $HOME/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/cc-1.0.25/src/lib.rs:2260:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.

warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
command did not execute successfully: "<MY_WORKTREE>/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/bin/cargo" "build" "--target" "x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu" "-j" "4" "--release" "--features" "panic-unwind jemalloc backtrace" "--manifest-path" "<MY_WORKTREE>/src/libstd/Cargo.toml" "--message-format" "json"
expected success, got: exit code: 101
thread 'main' panicked at 'cargo must succeed', bootstrap/compile.rs:1112:9
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
failed to run: <MY_WORKTREE>/build/bootstrap/debug/bootstrap build --stage 1 src/libstd --incremental
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:00:02
```

The problem is that the nested submodules at `src/libcompiler_builtins/compiler-rt` and `src/libcompiler_builtins/libm` are missing (`src/libcompiler_builtins` is itself a submodule, and these are 2 submodules of it). Manually copying the submodules results in a working build.

This looks like it's at its heart a git issue, but the worktree workflow is fairly useful and it would be nice if it can be worked around.

cc @alexcrichton
